lines.text: We part in radiant contentment.
Wally, this is no time to crack wise.
If I don't crack wise I'll crack up.
Help yourself to some of your father's product.
Not me. That's what killed mama.
He's smart, boss. I listen to him every night.
Doesn't seem to have done you much good.
Well, I feel like a new woman. In fact, I feel like a new man. Bring me a telephone book.
[Buzz and Fran enter a night club]
How many?
Three.
You said three?
I hope we're being followed.
One gentleman for two ladies?
Oh, it's all right. I'm just going to watch.
[to an over-sized housekeeper]
Aren't you wrestling somewhere tonight?
[trying to warn Harvey his toothpaste has been poisoned]
Do Not... Brush... Your Teeth!
Don't worry, I won't even take them out of my mouth.
I leave you now in radiant contentment.
Don't worry about me - Because that's what I'm doing.
I've got cold spines running up and down my chills.
What are you? A man or a mouse?
I'm a man, but tell me if you see a cat coming.
My son's Herman too. He's learning the business.
Following in his father's fingerprints?
I'm sorry JJ. I was just trying to ease your mind.
You can ease my mind by not using yours.
What could come through a little hole like that?
A bullet!

[Entering the room]
Good morning, ladies. I trust you had a pleasant hight.

[Sarcastucally]
Oh, yes. Every time I woke up I had a nightmare.
It was probably just your imagination.
Didn't you hear it too?
Sure but I got a pretty good imagination.

[a sword swings down and just misses him]
If that's a joke I'm glad I didn't get the point.

[Impatient with Wally's stubbornness]
Let me persuade him. I won't leave any marks.
Listen, I'm more stubborn when I'm unconscious.
Yeah, well, how can you tell when you're unconscious?

[With false bravado]
Oh, I got ways. I got ways.
